lines.title: Phone lines
lines.description:
Configure SIP account/s to allow VoIP communication via DECT handsets
To create a new connection, select 'New line'. To change the settings of an existing line, choose it from the list.
The telephone line for an outgoing call is selected automatically, based on the Dial rules and line priorities. Line priority is determined by number: higher number/higher line priority. To make sure the priority and dial rule settings are correct, select 'Call routing test'.

line-status.unplugged: DECT module is not plugged in

editor-popup.title: Telephone line settings
editor-popup.description: Specify the connection settings provided by your VoIP provider. For more details on advanced settings for phone lines, please refer to the Keenetic Plus DECT support page.

section.codecs-list-description: Codecs are applied in the order in which they are listed. To change the order, drag and drop.
section.priority-and-dial-rules: Dial rules and priority of lines

confirm.delete-line: The phone line will be deleted

form.prefix-substitution-rule: Prefix substitute rule for incoming calls
form.sdp-nat-rewrite: Get to know own public IP address from SIP server
form.lock-single-codec: Negotiate a single codec for an outgoing call

call-test-popup.title: Call routing test
call-test-popup.description: The DECT module selects the outgoing call direction given your phone lines states, their dial rules and priorities, and also individual permissions for outgoing calls given to DECT handsets. Enter a telephone number and then select Test button.
